subsection_name: lo-tieu-lech-thap.json_3_Causes of hypospadias and risk factors
subsection_content:
The cause of hypospadias in children is due to abnormal development of the anterior urethra, corpus spongiosum, corpus cavernosum and foreskin during pregnancy. In addition, some other causes of this defect include: (3)
Defective epidermal growth factors on the ventral surface of the penis; Vascular defects in the penile area; Enzymes are also associated with neonatal hypospadias due to deficiencies in testosterone biosynthesis; In vitro fertilization (IVF) is one of the causes that increases the incidence of hypospadias in boys.
In vitro fertilization may increase the child's risk of hypospadias
